com.acrolinx.javasdk.gui.threading

Interface TaskManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractTaskManager, SingleThreadTaskManager

    public interface TaskManager
    The interface TaskManager gives a GUI framework-specific implementation of the Java SDK the possibility to run methods in correct threads.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static TaskManager SINGLE_THREAD_TASKMANAGER
      See SingleThreadTaskManager

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void runInControlThread(Runnable runnable)
      runInControlThread is used for GUI frameworks which require all control operations to run in a special thread.
      void runInNewThread(Runnable runnable)
      If the Java SDK must run a method in a new thread it will call this method.

    • Field Detail

      • SINGLE_THREAD_TASKMANAGER

        static final TaskManager SINGLE_THREAD_TASKMANAGER
        See SingleThreadTaskManager

    • Method Detail

      • runInNewThread

        void runInNewThread(Runnable runnable)
        If the Java SDK must run a method in a new thread it will call this method. Note: If this method does not fork the Java SDK could deadlock.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable run in a new thread

      • runInControlThread

        void runInControlThread(Runnable runnable)
        runInControlThread is used for GUI frameworks which require all control operations to run in a special thread.
        Parameters:
        runnable - the runnable running in control thread
